Privacy Policy

Your privacy matters. As an open-source project, we're committed to transparency.

Last updated: February 25, 2026

TL;DR

  • ✓We collect minimal data needed to operate
  • ✓We never sell your personal information
  • ✓ZSE library contains no telemetry or tracking
  • ✓Our code is open source and auditable

Information We Collect

As an open-source project, we collect minimal information:

  • •Website Analytics: Basic, anonymized usage data (page views, country) to improve our documentation. We do not use cookies for tracking.
  • •Contact Form: When you contact us, we collect your name, email, and message to respond to your inquiry.
  • •GitHub: If you contribute to ZSE, GitHub collects information according to their privacy policy.
  • •PyPI: Package download statistics are collected by PyPI, not by us.

How We Use Your Information

We use the information we collect to:

  • •Respond to your inquiries and support requests
  • •Improve our documentation and website
  • •Communicate important updates about ZSE (only if you've opted in)

We never sell your data. As an open-source project, our goal is to build great software, not to monetize your information.

Data Security

We take reasonable measures to protect your information:

  • •All website traffic is encrypted via HTTPS
  • •Contact form submissions are transmitted securely
  • •We limit access to personal information to team members who need it

As an open-source project, our codebase is publicly auditable.

Third-Party Services

Our website may use the following third-party services:

  • •Vercel: Website hosting (see Vercel's privacy policy)
  • •GitHub: Source code hosting and collaboration
  • •PyPI: Python package distribution
  • •ZeptoMail: Email delivery for contact form

Each service has its own privacy policy governing their data practices.

Open Source Commitment

ZSE is licensed under Apache 2.0, which means:

  • •The source code is freely available for inspection
  • •You can verify exactly what our software does
  • •No hidden telemetry or data collection in the ZSE library
  • •Community contributions are welcome and transparent

We believe in transparency and user privacy as core values.

Contact Us

If you have questions about this privacy policy or your data:

  • •Email: zse@zyoralabs.com
  • •GitHub: Open an issue on our repository

We'll respond to privacy-related inquiries within 30 days.

This privacy policy applies to the ZSE website and related services operated by Zyora Labs.
The ZSE open-source library itself does not collect any user data.
